abstract: A 100-year-old law in New York State bans the use of a person’s name and likeness for advertising purposes without permission. That may be what Facebook’s new Social Ads system does.
snippet: A 100-year-old law in New York State bans the use of a person’s name and likeness for advertising purposes without permission. That may be what Facebook’s new Social Ads system does.
lead_paragraph: Mark Zuckerberg promised no less than a revolution with his idea that ads you see on Facebook will be attached to the names and photos of your friends who like the products being advertised.
